intro: Psammisia cyathifera, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is adapted to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
